segment.documentation: BGM, A segment to indicate the type and function of the message.
RFF, A segment to specify message reference.
DTM, A segment to specify associated dates/times as required related to the message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to specify name/address, person or department in the originating administration who can provide further information about the data in the message.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the name, address and related function.
CTA, A segment to identify a person or department in the sending administration to contact.
COM, A segment to identify communication numbers of departments or persons to whom communication should be directed (e.g. telephone/fax number).

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to indicate information related to each leg of the mode of transport.

segment.documentation: TDT, A segment to specify details of transport related to each leg, including means of transport, mode of transport name/number of vessel/vehicle/flight.
DTM, A segment to specify associated dates/times as required related to details of transport.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments indicating associated locations and dates.

segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to specify locations such as place of departure, place of destination, country of ultimate destination, country/place of transit, country of transit termination, etc. of a passenger/crew.
DTM, A segment to specify associated dates/times as required related to locations.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to indicate if passenger or crew member, personal details (name, title, sex and marital status), date of birth, attributes such as height, hair and eye colour, and other related details.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment specifying name of the passenger or crew member.
ATT, A segment specifying passenger's/crew attributes such as complexion and build.
DTM, A segment to specify date of birth.
MEA, To specify physical measurements, (e.g. height).
GIS, A segment to specify indicators such as risk assessment.
FTX, A segment specifying other related passenger/crew information (e.g. ticketing information).
LOC, A segment indicating country of nationality, country of birth and port/place of origin (embarkation), transit and destination (disembarkation) of a passenger/crew.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments to indicate the travel document details, date and time, reference, place/location identification.

segment.documentation: DOC, A segment identifying passenger/crew travel documents, such as passports, visas etc.
DTM, A segment to specify associated dates/times related to documents.
GIS, A segment to specify processing indicators, such as document holder, alias, endorsee etc.
RFF, A segment to specify document reference.
LOC, A segment indicating the country that issued the document.
CNT, A segment specifying control totals such as the total number of passengers/ crew members in the message.
AUT, A segment to specify the results of the application of an authentication procedure, including the authenticity of sender to ensure integrity of data.
